content.question: A function <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>f</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> has a Maclaurin series given by <math alttext="2 plus 3 x, plus x squared, plus one third times x cubed, plus, dot dot dot" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mn>2</mn><mo>+</mo><mn>3</mn><mi>x</mi><mo>+</mo><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></msup><mo>+</mo><mo>â‹¯</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>, and the Maclaurin series converges to <math alttext="f of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></math> for all real numbers <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>. If <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> is the function defined by <math alttext="g of x, equals, e to the f of x power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mi>g</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mi>f</mi><mo>(</mo><mi>x</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></msup></mrow></math>, what is the coefficient of <math alttext="x squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>x</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></math> in the Maclaurin series for <math alttext="g" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>g</mi></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="one half times e squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="five halves times e squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>5</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="eleven halves times e squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>11</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="eleven halves times e squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>11</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

topic.text: 10.11: (BC ONLY) Finding Taylor Polynomial Approximations of Functions

skill.text: Skill 2.B: Identify mathematical information from graphical, numerical, analytical, and/or verbal representations.
